title: Inserting builtin macro transcribers for builtin derive macros causes ICE

milestone.title: AST Pipeline for libcore 1.49 Complete
milestone.description:
This targets multiple parts of libcore 1.49:

1. Macro expansion
2. Builtin macro declarations
3. Proper name resolution
4. Proper handling of import statements

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#[rustc_builtin_macro]
#[stable(feature = "rust1", since = "1.0.0")]
#[allow_internal_unstable(core_intrinsics, libstd_sys_internals)]
pub macro RustcDecodable($item:item) {
    /* compiler built-in */
}
```

I expected to see this happen: no error

Instead, this happened:
```rust
crab1: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
0x402237c crash_signal(int)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/toplev.cc:314
0x1f742cc std::_Function_base::_M_empty() const
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/std_function.h:247
0x1f742a4 std::function<Rust::AST::Fragment (Location, Rust::AST::MacroInvocData&)>::operator bool() const
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/std_function.h:574
0x1f73c51 std::function<Rust::AST::Fragment (Location, Rust::AST::MacroInvocData&)>::function(std::function<Rust::AST::Fragment (Location, Rust::AST::MacroInvocData&)> const&)
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/std_function.h:389
0x2141ffc Rust::Analysis::Mappings::insert_macro_def(Rust::AST::MacroRulesDefinition*)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/util/rust-hir-map.cc:892
0x21b4e7e Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::visit(Rust::AST::MacroRulesDefinition&)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/resolve/rust-early-name-resolver.cc:902
0x1f31920 Rust::AST::MacroRulesDefinition::accept_vis(Rust::AST::ASTVisitor&)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/ast/rust-ast.cc:4819
0x21b6aa5 Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2::operator()() const
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/resolve/rust-early-name-resolver.cc:104
0x21b6a14 void std::__invoke_impl<void, Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2&>(std::__invoke_other, Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2&)
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/invoke.h:61
0x21b69c4 std::enable_if<__and_<std::is_void<void>, std::__is_invocable<Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2&> >::value, void>::type std::__invoke_r<void, Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2&>(Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2&)
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/invoke.h:154
0x21b68ec std::_Function_handler<void (), Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)::$_2>::_M_invoke(std::_Any_data const&)
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/std_function.h:290
0x21ba444 std::function<void ()>::operator()() const
	/usr/bin/../lib64/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/12.2.1/../../../../include/c++/12.2.1/bits/std_function.h:591
0x21b9fec Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::scoped(unsigned int, std::function<void ()>)
	../../gcc/rust/resolve/rust-early-name-resolver.h:50
0x21b178e Rust::Resolver::EarlyNameResolver::go(Rust::AST::Crate&)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/resolve/rust-early-name-resolver.cc:102
0x2049233 Rust::Session::expansion(Rust::AST::Crate&)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/rust-session-manager.cc:874
0x2047aaf Rust::Session::compile_crate(char const*)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/rust-session-manager.cc:582
0x2047417 Rust::Session::handle_input_files(int, char const**)
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/rust-session-manager.cc:398
0x1ed2c36 grs_langhook_parse_file()
	/home/arthur/Git/rust-gcc/gccrs/build/gcc/../../gcc/rust/rust-lang.cc:183
Please submit a full bug report, with preprocessed source (by using -freport-bug).
Please include the complete backtrace with any bug report.
See <https://gcc.gnu.org/bugs/> for instructions.
```

This is caused by the Early Name Resolver inserting a non-existing builtint transcriber for the `RustcEncodable` builtin derive macro. That transcriber will never be used, because builtin derive macros do not work on tokens - so we can add a dummy/empty transcriber to the builtin derive macros.

### Meta

- What version of Rust GCC were you using, git sha if possible.

1eef15537f2
